history.content:
I'm in 186 right now: The current workload is 6 projects over the course of the semester, with a vitamin each week. If you haven't taken a class with vitamins, they're short problem sets hosted on gradescope with problems very similar to the ones from the discussion worksheets. You can usually complete them relatively easily just by attending discussion and paying attention when the GSI walks through the problems. It's not like 170 or other classes where the problem sets are challenging and take lots of thinking. The projects so far haven't been as time consuming as other project oriented classes in my opinion. Overall, I'd say it is so far one of the lighter upper divs, even if the difficulty may have increased a bit from what it used to be.

edit post midterm 1: I don't know if that exam was an outlier, but it was brutal. I definitely think the class is much harder than I did when I wrote this post initially if that exam was anything to go off of.

children.subject: ^ For the student answer, do keep in mind that the project workload increases during the semester (projects 1-4 are in increasing difficulty, but then project 5 is shorter than project 4)

186 is about as difficult and time consuming as Hilfinger's 61B.

Expect intense Java projects, and moderate (or slightly easy) midterms. The cool thing is that the class doesn't have HWs or Labs -- the weekly vitamins (which are like Khan Academy-esque quizzes about the lectures), projects, and midterms are all you have to worry about. This makes the hard projects more manageable. The class has a generous curve, but don't mistake that for the class being easy. It certainly takes considerable effort to do well.

history.content:
I'm deciding which classes to take for next semester, and was pretty set on taking CS 186. However, I found this interesting blurb on the Syllabus page for this semester's offering: "Students have noted an increase in difficulty compared to offerings of this course predating Fall 2018."

Could a student who's taken this class recently comment on the overall workload?
history.subject: Increased difficulty of CS 186?
